constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Change of use of rear first floor from ancillary Retail (Class A1)  to Dwellings (Class C3), including erection of a second floor rear extension to create 2no. x  maisonettes (1x 2B4P and 1x 1B2P) at 1st and 2nd floor levels, with associated communal amenity space and cycle store and bins stores.
decision_conditions: The proposal would result in unacceptable the loss of existing employment floor space which would be contrary to Policy DM17 of the Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012).

The proposed second floor/roof extension would appear as a bulky and discordant addition that would have a significant adverse effect on the character and appearance of the host building and the surrounding area. As such, the proposal fails to comply with National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the adopted Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012).

The proposed unit would not provide satisfactory standards of accommodation for future occupiers due to lack of private amenity space. The proposal is contrary to  Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2021).

The proposal would result in an unacceptable loss of amenity for neighbouring residents by reason of loss of privacy to habitable rooms and private amenity spaces of No.s 2 & 4 Staunton Road. The proposal would therefore result in an unacceptable impact upon residential amenity and would conflict with the NPPF (2019), Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

In the absence of a legal agreement to ensure that future occupants of the proposed development would be precluded from obtaining on-street car parking permits, the proposed development would lead to inconsiderate parking and increase on-street car parking pressure and congestion in surrounding streets.  As such, the proposal is considered to conflict with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policy T.4 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies DM9 and DM10 of the adopted Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012).

The submitted Proposed Signage Elevation does not measure to the stated scale.Please provide proposed plans, elevations and sections - to show the following details on scaled drawings:the method, type and colour of illuminationis it externally or internally lit?type of lighting - spot lights, trough lights, halo illumination?the size of the light fittings.submit existing and proposed sections through any fascia or projecting sign making sure the section is cut through to show the illumination at scale 1:20.

Please provide a Block Plan drawn at an identified standard metric scale (such as 1:200 or 1:500) showing the proposed signage (hatched/shaded or lines along facades) in relation to the existing buildings, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site. The Block Plan must show the direction of North and should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultees and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to Condition 12 (Cycle Parking) of planning permission 22/01273/KPSID which states: Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level (excluding concrete frame), details of safe, secure and covered cycle parking facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates (74 no. long stay, 22 no. short stay and including 5% of overall provision for larger and adapted bicycle), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The developer is also encouraged to provide additional safe, secure and covered cycle parking to further promote sustainable forms of transport and minimise the impact of the development on the local highway network.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Please provide adequate information regarding your proposed schedule of works by how much you would like to reduce the trees in metres to comply with BS 3998: 2010 Tree Work - Recommendations within the application boundary and any which will be affected outside of the site boundary (if any).

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed are acceptable and will not have an adverse effect on the tree or reduce its amenity value. Recommendation: Approve tree surgery work.

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed are acceptable and will not have an adverse effect on the trees or reduce their amenity value. Recommendation: Approve tree surgery work.

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed are acceptable and will not have an adverse effect on the tree or reduce its amenity value. Recommendation: Approve tree surgery work.
The proposed site is categorised as a flat in our record, therefore we require full planning application form the submitted form is for householder. Please submit full planning application form.

Please clarify the replacement of windows and door are for one flat or more than one flat.  The fee required for  joint planning application is Â£ 509.00. We acknowledge the receipt of Â£258.00, please pay the outstanding balance of Â£251.00, if the application is for more than one flat.   Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website or our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002.
